snippet: French officials said they would not attend the commemoration of the 1994 massacres after President Paul Kagame of Rwanda accused France of “political preparation” in the killings.
abstract: French government, stung by critical remarks from Rwanda's Pres Paul Kagame that laid some blame for that country's 1994 genocide at the door of France, scales back its participation in 20th anniversary commemoration of massacres.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: French officials said they would not attend the commemoration of the 1994 massacres after President Paul Kagame of Rwanda accused France of “political preparation” in the killings.

headline.main: France Curtails Role at Genocide Services After Rwanda Leader Casts Blame
headline.print_headline: France Curtails Role at Genocide Services After Rwanda Leader Casts Blame

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
